intro: Cissus hederifolia, commonly known as the ivy-leaved dewplant, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, glossy leaves that resemble those of ivy, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is a member of the family Vitaceae, which includes many climbing plants. Cissus hederifolia is also known for its ability to exude a sticky substance from its stems, which can be used as a natural adhesive.
